reviews.review_msg: This course has been generally dissapointing, Chem 360 has been by far the most disorganised course I have taken at SFU. Midterm was cancelled night before because she felt "we were not prepared" after we spent the weekend studying. Lon Capa unrelated to course, she couldn't even do all the questions herself. Notes riddled with mistakes. Boo

Posted Notes are rather disorganized and difficult to comprehend. LON CAPA assignments are completely unrelated to lecture material, however the written assignments are somewhat related. Granted it is one of the more difficult courses at SFU, it is not necessary to make it unbearable. Take this course with another prof. She is very nice though.
Funny prof, class itself on its own is difficult, tried his best to teach it to kids who have no idea whats going on... major scaling goes on :)

Not a bad teacher per se, but he has difficulty relating the material to the real world (lecture notes deal almost exclusively with math, with little mention of what the formulae actually mean or how to use them).
He is hot, but his lecture kinda boring.The exams are fair.
